column1: swing. Marginally in from the corridor. Raval gets forward and offers such soft hands on the defence, the ball ends up between his feet
length and some shape in again. At off stump. Once again, soft hands on the defensive. Stolen single pitch side
short of a length and climbing in the corridor. Left alone
past short leg. Short of a length and curving into his hips. Pushed aerially off the back foot, but too far away to that fielder's left
tickled down towards fine leg...or not. No shot offered, deems the umpire. This ball swung into the thigh guard and deflected down to fine leg, with some help from the diving keeper. Dead ball
length and in at off stump. Blocked solidly off the back foot
142kph, length and slanted across from off stump. Blocked solidly on the front foot
138kph, slammed short of a length and pushed across. Left alone. Nice carry, taken at waist height
142kph, full and just outside off. Jams the bat down on this, slightly away from the body. But there's no movement. Mid-off cleans up
short and climbing through the corridor. Left alone
length and just outside off, solidly defended on the front foot
bouncer at a leg stump line. Left alone. This one dips on the keeper
inside edge onto back thigh. Lakmal hoops it in from around the wicket. Raval defends the wrong line outside off on his front foot
length and curving in from wide outside off. Left alone
short and very wide outside off. Left alone
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
short of a length and angled into the corridor. Forced into the point region off the back foot
short of a length in the corridor, nicely behind the line to defend off the back foot
length and into the pads. Skids through and thuds the knee roll as he looks to flick
length on middle stump. Hard hands and an angled bat as he looks to defend this. Gets a thick outside edge to backward point
overpitched on leg stump, 146kph, and whipped down to fine leg
soft hands on the back foot defence. Short of a length in the corridor, thick outside half on this. Not even close to carrying to second slip, who stretches to his left to stop this
full and just outside off, jammed back to the bowler
yorker length at off stump, safely bunted into the leg side
short of a length outside off, left alone
length and just outside off, left alone
length and just outside off, this time slanting in. Left alone as it comes close to the stumps. But the front leg was covering off, he knew what he was doing
length and very wide outside off. Left alone
length and in at leg stump. Nicely defended into the leg side with soft hands. Had to keep that down and away from short leg
short of a length and cutting away from the corridor. Still not close enough to make him play
chopped away. Classic Raval. He's waited 25 minutes for the bad ball and when it's arrived, he's on his toes to get on top of the bounce and cut to the point boundary
length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot
length and in at leg stump, pushed to square leg's right
length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
yorker at off stump, 141kph, defended to mid-on
length and swung down leg side, can't get bat on that
short of a length, curving down leg side again. Looks to flick and is beaten
short of a length just outside off, tapped to point off the back foot
oh, narrowly past the bat. Length ball slanted into the corridor. Gets the front leg to cover off stump and tries to withdraw the bat very late. Nearly goes off the face
past midwicket. Short of a length and into the hips. Hurriedly clipped off the back foot and past the fielder's dive to his left
length and just outside off, tapped to mid-off
full and drifted in at leg stump. Blocked on the front foot
out comes the paddle. He likes playing that. Length and drifted in at middle stump. Deftly worked to deep backward square's left
length and in at leg stump, deflected fine off the back leg as he looks to glance
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and sliding in at leg stump. Worked behind square off the front foot
short and very wide, left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
length and in at off stump, solidly defended on the front foot

climbs over middle stump! Risky leave! Short of a length and starting in the corridor. Comes in with the angle and keeps coming in. I'm not sure he wanted to leave that on height....surely, right? Not in Galle. He survives, though
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, defends for the turn on the front foot, gets it off the inside half
length on middle stump, gets down and paddles it to deep backward square
some turn there. Looks like his slowest ball on the day. 77kph and dipping on a length at off stump. Defended off the outside half
length and tossed up outside off. Looks for the paddle but can't get it fine. It trickles harmlessly into where short leg was as he was scrambling to his left
short of a length outside off, cut to deep cover point
full on off stump, driven with the turn to mid-off
past the outside edge. Short of a length outside off, swishes inside the line
length and just outside off, left alone
length ball slanted in at middle stump. Defended off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, left alone
beaten. Latham pokes wide outside off. Length ball straightens as he gets on the front foot
length and in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and in at off stump. Anxious poke at it. Rolls out to backward point off the outside half
full on middle stump, punched off the front foot to mid-on
length and slanted across the corridor. Left alone
short at an off stump line. Drops the bat and lets it pass
length at off stump, tapped past the non-striker off the high part of the bat
misfield but still not full value for a sweet drive down the ground. Full ball just outside off,half a stride and a full swing through the line. Mid-off can't stop cleanly to his left
short of a length just outside off, nudged into the covers off the back foot
75kph, length and turning away outside off. Left alone
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, punched to cover
past the leading edge. This slowness is visibly bother New Zealand's batsmen. Down for the paddle sweep very early again, but it spins away from outside off
big turn. He's figured out the pace now. Dipping, ripping outside off. Latham not close to defending that
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
steep. Short ball in the corridor, jumping up. Gloves and bat safely out of the way as he lets it go
bouncer down leg side, ducks it
another bouncer. Middle stump line. Watches it closely again as he sways inside the line to let it go
short at an off stump line. Hands down, head sways away. Left alone
short of a length on leg stump, 145kph, thuds into the thigh guard as he looks to flick
full on leg stump, clipped to deep square. Nicely survived from Raval
breaks away from a length on off, Raval is on the backfoot as he defends
beauty! Draws him forward, gets it to drift in a long way and then turn square to beat Raval's tentative prod
slows it down beautifully, Raval gets a long way forward and leaves this
spins away from outside off, this is pushed through quicker, Raval lets it go
touch short this time, he rocks back and cuts behind point. Flew off the edge, not where he intended but runs welcome at this stage
goes right back into the crease and punches to extra cover
short, wide and Latham transfers weight onto the backfoot as he gets on top of the bounce to flay this in front of square. Through cover point. Cracking stroke
cuts back in a long way from around the stumps, Latham rapped on the thigh pad. Hurried by the pace on the delivery
floats it full and wide outside off, throwing an open invitation to drive, 'no thanks' says Latham as he leaves
goes full and straight from wide of the crease, Latham looks for the on-drive but gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
gets well forward and pats it to midwicket as they steal a single that should've never been
goes full, just outside off but there isn't much movement this time, left alone
beaten by sharp turn as he lunges forward to stab with hard hands
touch short but sharp turn again from off-stump, he rocked back to cut but let it go in the end
too short, drifting in and he whips this through the gap at square leg. Lovely wrist work and transfer of the weight back. Long chase for the in-fielders as the ball stops near the boundary
gets well forward and smothers the spin
drifts in a long way to fool Raval into thinking he's got the line covered, but this wickedly spins away to beat the edge
this time he's covered the line nicely as he gets forward to dab that away
steers this shortish delivery to point
flatter and fuller on the stumps, kept out
swept from outside off towards square leg
goes full, squeezed back to the bowler. Was looking to drill it back past
saved by some bat! It's the premeditated paddle which he nearly misses. Somehow managed little bat as this raced past short fine. Would've been plumb had he missed that
gets well forward and smothers this
rolls back to the bowler off an inside-edge as he lunges forward to defend
ill-directed. Too full and drifting down leg, paddled round the corner
crashes this cut to Embuldeniya, who is 20 yards in from the ropes at deep point
too full and straight, defended back
makes room and punches to cover, excellent stop by Karunaratne diving to his right
drifts in a full toss which he flicks into the gap at midwicket, easy pickings
crunched into the extra cover region! Too full, half-volley and he absolutely drilled that into the gap. So good to watch
shortish and drifting in, pushed back
punches this to short cover
gets outside the line of the stumps as he defends this full delivery
lofted off-drive, clears mid-off. Safe shot. Got close to the pitch of the ball as he played this u and over. Solid hit
goes right back into the crease and turns this gently into the leg side
a touch short outside off, cut away to point
gets well forward and smothers this tossed up delivery
it's the legbreak this time, he was looking to sweep but changed his mind as it dipped on him, defended instead
ferocious sweep! Drifts down leg and he powers this into the gap at deep backward square leg. Rolled his wrists nicely over the ball
gets a good stride forward as he smothers this
goes right back and across as he nudges this behind square on the leg side
short, spinning back in, turned to deep midwicket
touch fuller but it's slow turn off the deck, defended off the backfoot to short leg
works this with the spin to mid-on for a quick single, caught napping there. Can't concede a single as easily as that
turns this gently to short leg again
nicely tossed up, drifts away and then spins in off the pitch, defended back
touch too full, he gets well forward and works this to mid-on
makes a bit of room and eases this into the gap behind square on the off side. Aggressive running to come back for the second
goes right back and across to bunt this to point
punched wide of backward point for an easy single
sharp turn from off-stump as he goes back to defend, beaten
gets well forward to defend this tossed up delivery

squirts this off a thick edge to short third man, Raval quick to get across but Latham, running to the danger end, was slow to react. There's a direct hit from Kusal Mendis at the striker's end, but he's in. Third umpire confirms that. Not out
hint of width and put away! Rocks back and crashes that behind point
sharp turn and bounce off a length on middle and leg, hit on the stomach as he tries to whip this square
turns this with the spin to short midwicket, nicely tossed up again
draws him forward with the flight, Latham pats it with soft hands
lunges forward and turns this into the leg side
fired full and straight, turned to the leg side again
nice flight, lands this outside off, smothered
eased to point. Raval was on the backfoot, this kept a touch low
gets well forward as he defends this
head right over the ball, smells leather as he defends
drifts in to middle, he gets forward and defends back
too full on the stumps, kept out
turns this length delivery to midwicket
full, drifting into middle and leg, kept out
works this with the spin to long-on
gets outside the line of the stumps and defends
steps out and whips this full toss straight to Mathews at mid-on. Scoring chance missed
squeezes this to mid-on
leading edge that rolls past silly point. Was looking to ease this into the leg side as the ball drifted in
worked wide of mid-on for a quick single, once again poor from the fielders. Shouldn't have been a single

thin edge and gone! It's the bite off the deck that has done the trick for Akila. Latham's indecisiveness has cost him. This drifts in, turns sharp and Latham, who is on the backfoot looking to cut, suddenly bails out and simply leaves his bat dangling out. The ball kisses the edge and it's nicely taken by Dickwella.
nicely tossed up, Williamson gets well forward and eases this into the covers
gets across and turns this with the dip to short leg

chipped straight to short midwicket! What's just happened? Massive, massive wicket. This is short, spinning in but the ball gets stuck into the pitch. Williamson is simply looking to tuck it gently for a single but gets it high on the bat and it's a simple catch. Three-ball duck for Williamson and how the game has turned! Williamson was looking to sweep but credit to the bowler for shortening his length to elicit a gentle nudge
goes right back into the crease to defend this tossed up delivery
eases this down to mid-on as he gets to the pitch of the ball
right behind the line as he defends
shortish outside off, pushed back
touch short on middle, defended back as he gets on top of the bounce
gets well forward and smothers this
squirts this in-drifter into the off side as he defends off the backfoot
looks for an expansive drive, doesn't read this googly. Leaves a big gap between bat and pad, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad
goes right back and turns this shortish delivery into the leg side
wrong'un again, there's some fizz on this but Taylor gets on top of the bounce and turns this wide of leg gully. Tardy effort from Thirimanne
gets a good stride forward and smothers this
gets a long way forward to defend again
defends this tossed up delivery from the crease to plenty of oooohs and aaahs
sweeps and gets an under-edge, Dananjaya runs across from short fine to pull the ball back in just as it was about to cross the ropes. Great effort
pitches on middle and leg, defended
works this shortish delivery wide of midwicket for an easy single
arm-ball which skids back in to hurry Taylor, who somehow manages to nudge this to the leg side
full-length dive at midwicket but Mathews ends up knocking this to mid-on and they get a run. Lucky to get away with a full delivery
cut away, good stop at point to keep it to a single

edged to slip! What a time to go. Raval lunges forward a long way to defend but is done in by the dip, this is a feeble push to a googly that doesn't turn as much and Dhananjaya takes an excellent catch diving forward. What a comeback this has been for Sri Lanka and they'll take lunch
length on off stump, nicely forward to block
short of a length at off stump, onto the back foot to defend
short of a length on off stump, a googly. Defended to point
tossed up at off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up on off stump, dead-batted down the pitch
full on middle stump, drilled against the turn to mid-on
full on off stump, driven to extra cover off the front foot
tossed up on leg stump, looks to sweep, cops it on the pad
leading edge as he steps out premeditatedly and goes against the turn. Rolls out to extra cover
slugged away. Taylor plants his front leg across, gets the bat from around it and sends this length ball to the square leg boundary. This one didn't turn too much
left alone. Tossed up at 78kph outside off.  Big stride to cover off stump before he lets that go
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up middle and off. Defends close to the body off the outside half of the bat
full on leg stump, closes the face as he defends on the front foot
oh nicely played. This is one of Nicholls' best shots. Tossed up on middle stump, gets very far forward and very low to get on top of the bounce. Sweeps in front of square
overthrows. Short of a length and wide outside off. Backs away and slaps it to extra cover who has a shy at the non-striker's end. Mathews is given an early jog at mid-off
full on off stump, dead-batted down the pitch
short of a length and turning away from off stump. Deep in the crease to defend on the back foot
chipped over mid-on. Steps out, meets it at the pitch and checks this lofted drive at the last moment. It plonks into the turf and the fielder can pull this back in at the line
full on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
arm ball. Length and across off stump. Solidly watched on the back foot defence
length at leg stump, flicked straight to short leg
length ball turning into off stump. Defended on the front foot
length and down leg side. Whipped to deep backward square off the back foot
turn and bounce. Short of a length and climbing up outside off as he gets on the back foot. Has a stab at it and is beaten
arm ball, short of a length outside off. Gets back and punches to cover's left
slider, short of a length at middle stump. Punched to deep square off the back foot
full and down leg side. Looks to sweep and gets an under-edge that is stopped by the keeper's pad
beaten. Taylor having an expansive swat at what is clearly a sucker ball. Lobbed right up and very wide, turning away from off stump. Doesn't get close
length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
sweet. Much better from Taylor. Steps out and gets to the pitch this time outside off, and then controls his drive to bisect bowler and mid-off
full on off stump, drives to that mid-off fielder who is now deeper after last ball
full outside off stump, steps out, meets it on the full and flicks down to deep mid-on
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
beats him. Drawn forward on off stump and done by the bounce
full on middle stump, low, front foot out of the way, and a sweep along the floor to deep backward square
full on middle stump, flicked down to long-on
full outside leg stump, swept firmly again. Deep square sprints to his left and uses one hand to flick this back in with a dive. Kumara there with the effort
googly, full outside off. Dead-batted to extra cover
length on off stump, nudged to extra cover off the front foot
length on middle, steps out and drives to long-on
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
full on middle stump, flicked to long-on
length ball at middle. Looks to defend for the turn and feels this on the inside edge
length outside off, steps out and drives to deep mid-off
beaten. Legbreak from Akila. Short of a length and ripping away from off stump to climb past his cut
length outside off, shuffles and pushes to midwicket
legbreak again. Length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
tossed up at off stump, defended on the front foot
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
tossed up outside off, springs down at it and drives to long-off. Extra cover gets a hand on it on the way
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
beaten in flight but manages to squeeze it into the leg side. Lobbed up at a length on middle stump and he flicks with hard hands after stepping out
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at middle, steps out and drives to long-on
full outside off, paddled out to deep backward square
length outside off, blocked down the pitch on the front foot
googly at a length on off. Watched that closely and poked it to midwicket
length outside off, on the back foot to punch to long-on
full outside off, defended to midwicket off the inside half
full outside off, yorks himself and keeps it out
short and wide outside off, cut to point
length outside off, gets down for the sweep and swats as it rises. Finds deep square to his left
length on leg stump, nudged to deep square off the back foot
length on leg stump, steps out and drives to long-on
length and going on with the angle at off stump. Defended off the outside half
short of a length on off, defended to midwicket off the back foot
length at off stump, pushed down the pitch
length outside off, flicked to deep midwicket
fired in at middle stump, sliding on with the arm from around the wicket. Inside edge onto pad as he defends away from the body
chases outside off to defend this. Length and turning away from him
arm ball again, sliding in at off stump. Hurriedly punched to point off the back foot
length and straightening outside off, defended to point
steps out and is forced to defend. That is nicely done from the bowler. Drags the length back a touch but keeps it loopy
length outside off, tapped to extra cover off the back foot

and this is Taylor striking back. Makes the young bowler drop his length after all the stepping out, and then camps deep in the crease. Allows this short one to come on and sends it to the midwicket boundary with a pull
length outside off, steps out and bat-pads into the pitch
short of a length outside off, turning away. Tapped to extra cover off the back foot
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right and Akila there puts in a big slide to stop it
short and wide outside off. Allows it to skid on and chops it through the open point region
length and wide outside off. Left alone
short of a length outside off, punched to cover's left
short of a length on off stump, punched to midwicket's left off the back foot
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
length outside off, leans in and slices on the up to beat point to his right
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, shuffles and turns it to deep square
length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length just outside off, soft hands on the forward block and that means the outside edge races past gully
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, driven to long-on

poor throw and Taylor survives! Near self-destruction there from New Zealand. Short of a length ball, quicker and fired in at middle stump. Nicholls backs away and taps this to extra cover's right. He wants the run. Taylor hesitates. But Dimuth can't get this throw close to the stumps with Taylor miles out at the striker's end
full at the stumps, gets low and paddles it on the full
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up at off, blocked on the front foot
inside edge. A hint of inswing there. Short of a length outside off and he wanted to slap it on the rise. Got it into his body
length and just outside off, blocked towards mid-on
length and in at middle stump. Plants the front leg across for the flick but can't get bat on it. Deflected towards fine leg off the pad
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
length ball down leg side. Kicks it
short of a length on middle stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
length and wide outside off. Left alone
short of a length and speared in at off stump. Left alone
length on middle stump, steps out and mistimes the drive to mid-on. Lost his shape there
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full and slanting in from wide of the crease, defended
width and he thumps this on the up into the gap at extra cover
veers a length ball back in from wide of the crease, defended back
goes full outside off, holds its line this one, Taylor is well forward in defence
digs out this attempted yorker to sweeper cover
touch full on the pads, flicked to midwicket
swept from outside off to deep square. Kept it all along the ground as he rolled his wrists over the delivery nicely
goes right back and across to keep out this full delivery on the stumps
eases this down to long-on as he jogs the single
gets outside the line of the stumps and sweeps this all along the ground to deep square
too much flight, he's besides the line and has the room to free his arms as he belts this drive to deep point
swept hard, short leg cops a blow as he parries this to square leg
floats this full outside off, pushed into the covers
gets well forward and shows the full face of the bat to ease this to mid-on
angles a full ball in from wise of the crease, turned to mid-on
right under the nose as he defends this length ball from the crease
squirts this full delivery off a thick inside edge to square leg
slightly overbalanced as he negotiates this incoming length delivery into the leg side
huge appeal as he sweeps and misses, obviously for lbw. Struck outside the line though
tossed up outside off, swept all along the ground to deep square
too full outside off, pushed into the covers
driven firmly wide of point for an easy single
drifting down leg, swept with the spin to fine leg
steps out to drive but ends up slicing this off a thick outside edge past point
gets on top of the bounce and turns this length delivery into the gap at midwicket
slants a full ball across, defended from the crease
zippy length ball angled across the left-hander, bunted with soft hands
too much leg side, whips this down to long leg
works this full delivery from outside of towards midwicket
neatly tucked off his hip to deep square to bring up his 31st Test fifty
shortish and drifting in, punched back to the bowler
makes room and punches this to long-off
struck on the pad as he looks to whip this shortish delivery that spun back in a long way from leg stump
tucks this to square leg. Bowling too short currently, not going to trouble batsmen with that length
punched down to long-on
squeezes this drive back to the bowler
picks the length early and pulls this short ball all along the ground towards deep midwicket
gets outside the line of the stumps and pulls this to fine leg
opens the bat face to run this past gully for an easy single

banged in short, he takes on the pull and picks the bones out of it. Deep square was no more than 10 yards away from the ball as he ran across but stood no chance because this was ferociously played. The field was set for the pull, presumably for the top-edge but that plan will have to wait
squirts this drive to gully off a thick outside edge
lunges a long way forward and smothers this tossed up delivery
works this with the spin to deep square leg
punched into the gap at cover
steps out to whip but ends up getting to close to it, squirted back to the bowler
worked with the spin to long-on as he steps out
drifting down leg and Taylor plays a delicate premeditated paddle to fine leg
yorker-length on leg stump, squeezed back to the bowler
pulled well and in front of square to deep midwicket
slants a length ball towards middle, tucked to square leg
driven back to the bowler who grabs this on his followthrough
poor ball, slants a half-volley into the pads and he flicks this nicely into the acres of open space past square leg. Fine leg runs around to cut that off
punches this length delivery to mid-off

thumped away! Tardy effort from Kusal, who dives at deep square but after the ball had passed him at deep square. This was too short from Akila. He parried the ball over to the ropes, but didn't signal four, leaving the third umpire to adjudicate

I have no idea why he'd want to review that. This is full, drifting in from around the stumps, Nicholls sweeps and misses but the impact is on middle. He didn't deliver it from that far off, so the chances of this missing leg is minimal. There's a hint of turn away too, and hawkeye confirms this would've crashed into leg stump. New Zealand lose one against the run of play. Decision stays
didn't read this legbreak, off a thick inside edge past short leg as he prods outside the line
pulls this short ball to deep square
slow turn from outside off, worked to deep square
goes a long way across to work this square, ends up tickling it just short of leg gully. Loaded with risk that
hint of width outside off, he uses the pace to run this down to third man
too full, driven straight to extra cover
length on middle and leg, worked to square leg
crashed on the up to deep point. He's searching for some late away movement but there has been none so far
slow, dipping full toss outside off, driven to Embuldeniya at sweeper cover
gets right on top of the bounce and defends
sharp turn back in, worked to fine leg

and just like in the first session, Sri Lanka have picked up two quick strikes towards the end of it. Watling looks to whip this through midwicket but this one spins back in and keeps a touch low to hit him on the right pad. Plumb, would've smashed into the stumps.
length and drifted into leg stump. Inside edge as he prods at this with hard hands
length and just outside off. Tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
full on middle stump, bat-pad down the pitch on the front foot
length at off and turning away, defended off the back foot
length and just outside off. Blocked on the front foot
length and hanging up at an off stump line. Steps out and stabs it back down the pitch
tossed up on off stump, steps out, meets it on the full and drives to long-on
short and wide outside off, left alone
tossed up at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at middle, on the back foot to defend this
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
full on off stump, driven against the turn to mid-off
full legbreak on leg stump, swept down to long leg
full on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
googly, lobbed up at middle stump. Driven back past the bowler, mid-off cleans up
short of a length and turning into off stump. Gets back and squeezes it into the covers
length and drifting in at off. Defended on the front foot
length on middle stump, steps out and doesn't get to the pitch of this. But it doesn't turn away as he flicks to long-on
length on off, blocked on the front foot
length at leg stump, into the pads as he looks to block
laces this wide of mid-off! Clean striking. Tossed up wide outside off and his stride is big, and his hands fast. Doesn't allow any sort of turn
legbreak, length outside off. Flaps at it without getting to the pitch and it slices off the face through point
length on leg stump, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, punched to long-on
length and in at the stumps, poked into the covers
full on off stump, driven down the pitch
length and turning away from off, punched to extra cover
get out of here, Taylor says to both ball and short leg. This full ball drifts down leg and he absolutely pummels this with the sweep
short of a length outside off, cut to backward point
length on middle stump, lapped out to long leg
short of a length and turning into the body. Looks to sweep and gets an inside edge into his body
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on leg stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, defended off the inside half
full outside off, blocked with soft hands
appeal for catch. Not out. This spins past the inside edge as he pushes forward, lobs up to short leg off the pad
length on middle stump, shuffles and flicks to short leg
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball pitching on leg, turning further down. Left alone and nice take from Dickwella

length outside off, nudged into the covers on the front foot

full on off, comes forward and defends
shorter and drifting in, makes a little room and pushes to cover

full on off, defended from the crease
length outside off, another gentle delivery, Southee hangs his bat out and steers it past the slips for one
length and angled across, left alone
length and closer to off stump, teasing line from Lakmal, Santner watches it closely and decides to let it through
change of angle, from around the wicket, threatening to come in with the angle but leaves Santner ever so slightly to create a bit of indecision, but left alone safely in the end
full on middle, comes forward and defends
shorter and turning sharply back in, Southee goes right back and is struck on the thigh
shortish again, attempted leg break, Southee pushes it into the covers
beautiful delivery, just a touch short maybe, pitching around off and spinning away from Santner
shorter and quicker, angled in, pushed back to the bowler
full on off, comes down the wicket to smother the spin, pushes it to cover

fuller and closer to off stump, Santner wants nothing to do with it but much better length and line
pulls his length back a little again but goes closer to off, making Santner play, who presents a full face and defends solidly
goes fuller this time, slightly outside off, Santner comes forward but lets it through to the keeper, watching it very closely
length outside off, left alone again but nice tight bowling from Lakmal to keep the pressure on
off spinner on off, Southee comes forward and defends
tossed up around off, Southee doesn't take the bait and just pushes it to long-on
nearly through him, survives off the inside edge! He came forward to defend but the ball wasn't quite there and nearly went back on to the leg stump
shorter and quicker around middle, defended off the backfoot
full around off, opens the face and pushes it towards point for one

overpitched and driven nicely to mid-off, who is hanging on his heels and concedes a quick single, despite a direct hit at the non striker's end

shoulders arms and he's been given! Lakmal angled it in from around the wicket, he had been straightening them from that line, which is probably what prompted Santner to leave it alone but it just kept coming back in and struck him plumb in front. The replays suggest bounce could have been an issue but it would have remained out on umpires call
full outside off, left alone, another excellent over from Lakmal, who has made the breakthroughs this morning
full around off, Southee comes forward, opens the face and defends
leg break, too full, however, Southee uses his reach to smother the spin
googly, picked, Southee comes down the wicket and goes through the line, over long-on for maximum
leg break this time, angled in but too full, pushed to mid-off with the spin
googly, extra bounce, Southee goes back and defends uncomfortably

appeal for lbw, Southee takes off without realising exactly where the ball is and he's gone as well! It was another googly, not read by Southee but would have missed leg stump, the ball ricochets off the pad towards short third-man and Southee takes off for a suicidal run and can't make it back
full outside off, leans into it and pushes it to cover's right for one
length outside off, Boult watches it through to the keeper in a bit of a tribute to Courtney Walsh
full and drilled back to the bowler who hangs his hand out and saves a certain boundary
short one, outside off, Somerville sways out of its way
length outside off, defended late towards point
length outside off, gets it to straighter again and nearly takes the outside edge! He pulled his bat out at the last moment but was well and truly beaten there
full outside off, comes forward and defends

very full on middle, Boult digs it out towards slip
leg break, angled in, shorter, squares him up a little
full on off, skips down the wicket and pushes it back to the bowler
full around off, flatter delivery, Boult hangs back and defends awkwardly
full, edged but wide of third slip and into the  third man fence, as Lakmal concedes his first boundary. Crucial runs for New Zealand
full on off, defended into the covers, Boult was keen on the one but sent back by Somerville
length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off's left for a quick single
full toss and hammered down the ground by Boult who was already making room, perhaps expecting the short one but adjusted alright
length outside off, driven on the up through the covers for a couple
full outside off, watched right under his eyes and defended to point
googly around off, comes down the wicket and pushes it to midwicket
full on middle, comes forward and defends
googly, slower through the air, hangs back, closes the face and defends
leg break this time, shortish, which allows him to hang back and defends off the backfoot

given caught at short leg but reviewed immediately! Plenty of bounce there for Akila as Somerville lunged forward, the ball seemed to miss the bat and glove as it took the flap of the front pad and a bit of the elbow, as Somerville indicated when he reviewed before being taken at short leg. Decision reversed
another googly, slower outside off this time, and the slowness of the surface further allows Somerville to camp on the backfoot and pick it off the pitch
full around off, pushed into the covers for one
full outside off, drawing him forward, defended to point
that's turned square and bounced appreciably to beat the bat!
full on off, comes forward and defends

googly, Boult hangs back and defends

leg break, looks for the cut but misses, that was there to be hit
googly outside off, he comes down the wicket, gets outside the line and kicks it away, it bouncing quite a bit in any case
goes for the premeditated sweep from outside off, gets it on the grille off the top edge. In fact, funnily, the ball was stuck in the grille
length around off, skids on as he defends late
down the wicket and lofted over mid-off, and over the boundary, helped by the fact that it skid on again
down the wicket and pushed to long-on

oh you're kidding me. End this day. Length ball at leg stump, backs away, makes plenty of room and has a slog at it. It's come off the toe-end and floated straight out to deep mid-on

appeal for lbw is given. Patel has reviewed. Missed on the flick, right in front of middle stump. Lakmal is around the wicket. But that is not sliding down leg. Umpire's call and that is four for Lakmal
a lot of swing away. Short of a length but too wide to make him play. Taken in front of first slip
length and shaping away in the corridor. Hangs the bat away from the body to defend this
short of a length, 138kph and curving away in the corridor. Nicely on top of the bounce to defend this into the off side. Still pushing away from the body though
length outside off, stabs at it as it skids low. Into the covers
short of a length outside off, 139kph. Shuffles and defends into the leg side
late swing away but still too wide to make him play. His fullest ball of the over, just short of driving length

length and shaping in at leg stump, defended off the back foot into the leg side
diving stop at square leg. Full inswinger onto the pads and a sweetly timed shot from Lahiru again. Flicked off his shin
length outside off, defended into the off side with soft hands
nicely timed. Overpitched on middle and leg with a hint of movement in. But he's kept his head right on top of the ball with a half step across. Gently clips it past midwicket

leading edge. Rolls out to mid-off. Once again, looking to play the ball that comes in. It's full on middle and the head's dropped over into the off side as he looks to flick, and the bat face is closed too soon. Safe in the end
length outside off, defended on the front foot

full and just outside off. Tapped to mid-off's right on the front foot
beaten. Loose. Length ball cutting away outside off. Chases it a long way away from the body

full and and swung in at off stump. Tapped on the rise to mid-off
short of a length and cutting inwards. Starting too wide, however. Left alone
length and in at middle stump, nearly locks himself with a stride across, but controls this flick in the end. Past midwicket
lobbed full outside off, jammed out to mid-off on the front foot
steep climb from a length in the corridor. But that's well watched as he leaves
length on off stump, defended into the covers with soft hands
ducks but leaves the bat high as he deals with this short ball. Middle stump line and curving towards fine leg, so he gets away with it
full at middle stump, rooted to the crease as he flicks to mid-on

just short of midwicket. Length ball on leg stump and he offers hard hands on the flick

short of a length and skidding on. Opens the face and runs this to point
pushes with hard hands as this one is slowed way down to 77kph. Grips and turns after drifting in. No control as he slices to point's left
goes back to the quicker speed, 89kph, drops it short outside off, and he will not get away with that. Dimuth chops it late to point's right

full and a hint of late way swing. Driven off the low part of the bat to extra cover

gets it past midwicket. Much shorter stride this time. Clips the length ball from leg to mid-on's left
shot. Straight to point. Dropped short and wide and he springs into this square drive

length and skidding onto leg stump. Blocked into the leg side

nice loopy delivery outside off. A touch short and ripping in as he leaves it alone

that is a gorgeous delivery. Patel gets it to drift away late as it dips on a length. Thirimanne seems to have premeditatedly stepped out, because his attempted shot is a panic heave. Not getting anywhere close to that with the way this has curved away from him. Spins back in to Watling who takes off the bail
length outside off, gets forward and opens the face to run this past slip

dropped! Taylor looked surprised by that. Karunaratne pushing away from the body to a full ball, healthy edge at waist height. Taylor takes a tiny step to his left and that seems to have done him. Hurriedly flaps but can only get a thumb on it

short of a length outside off, guided to backward point
pushed full and down leg side. Meets it on the full and tickles it fine to bring up his tenth Test fifty. Been measured today

Taylor holds on! Third time's the charm. Did Mendis really think he could go driving with tea around the corner in this Test? Another batsman falls into the pre-break black hole. This is tossed up outside off and he looks to slam it through cover, away from the body. Heads straight into Taylor's mid-riff and he hangs on to it
full around off, comes down the wicket and drives it to mid-on to come through for a quick single to get underway
length, angled in, Mathews uses the depth of the crease and turns it around towards deep backward square leg
length on middle, pushed to mid-on

short and lobbed straight to point, inexplicable shot! He wasn't sure whether to ramp it over the slips or let it go, ended up doing neither, just hung his bat out meekly to gift New Zealand a wicket when nothing seemed to be happening
length and angled across, defended back from the crease
full and angled across, nice stride into the ball and driven straight to mid-off
length on the pads, tucked away towards square leg, shouts of 'yes and no' from both batsmen, eventually they decide against the run
length on the pads, uses the depth of the crease and turns it around to deep backward square leg
full on off, defended
full on off and middle, comes forward and defends

short outside off, bit of turn away but that actually helps the batsman's cause as he rocks back and cuts to point's right, teases the fielder right down to the boundary but eventually beats his full length dive
full on off and middle, defended
full on the pads, pushed to midwicket
length on middle, shuffles and tucks it away towards square leg for one
fuller around off, stays back and defends to the off side
length, angled across, stays back again and defends right under his eyes
shorter this time, angled away with a bit of extra bounce  but he does well to get on his toes and defend it towards gully
length on middle, closes the face and pushes it towards midwicket
fuller and angled across, stays back and defends solidly again
full on middle and off, defended back
full around off, draws him forward, Mathews obliges and defends to cover
shorter around off, goes back and defends
angled in on a length, Mathews thinks it's short, looks to cut and is beaten by the bounce
in the slot and Mathews just picks it up over the bowler's head, couple of bounces and into the straight boundary to release some of the pressure that was building
slightly shorter, Mathews goes back and defends to point
length around off, he continues to hang back, but again, defends right under his eyes. Might be in trouble if one keeps even slightly low, though
shorter around middle, nudged to the leg side
length on middle, tucked away towards square leg
another one back of a length, around the hip this time and tucked away to deep backward square leg for one
length again, angled across, Mathews shuffles ever so slightly and defends to cover
slower one, full and angled across, left alone
full and angled in, he comes down the wicket and has a go, nearly chips it to mid-on off a thick inside edge

he succeeds this time, that is to chip a return catch to the bowler! Similar delivery, tossed up around off, he almost got too close to it to get any elevation and hit it straight back to the bowler, who did well to take it around chest height for his fourth wicket. New Zealand have been allowed well and truly back into this game by two poor shots since tea
full on off, defended
full around off again, goes for the sweep but can't  beat short fine
full outside off, beautiful line, kicks off the surface and turns sharply back in, inside edge back on the pad
similar line, maybe a touch fuller, and he defends on the front foot
length outside off, Mathews shuffles and defends
length around off, Mathews stays back and defends expecting a bit of spin back, it goes on with the arm, takes the outside half of the bat, but along the ground and past slip
full on off, pushed to midwicket
full around off, Mathews comes down the wicket, gets to the pitch and works it around along the ground to deep midwicket for a single that gives him his fifty
full around off, another premeditated sweep, he misses due to the really full length and hint of turn away, but the optimistic appeal for lbw is turned promptly down
length outside off, left alone

edged and taken and he'll enjoy that! Worthy delivery to get a five-for with, time honoured cocktail of drift, dip and turn, drew him forward, it wasn't quite there, Mathews reached out with his hands, it pitched around middle and the turn away did the rest. New Zealand roar back into the contest
full on off, comes forward and defends
length outside off, defended off the backfoot
full outside off, pushed to mid-off
full on middle and leg, nearly chipped to midwicket
full outside off, driven to cover
full around middle and off, out comes the premeditated sweep, doesn't try to hit it too hard and gets two down to fine leg
full on off, pushed to mid-off for a quick single
tossed up outside off, he comes forward to defend and is beaten comprehensively by the sharp turn and bounce
another one, slightly shorter this time, threatens to angle in, spins away sharply from off to beat the bat

he never looked like getting in and Somerville has worked him out third time. It was fuller and outside off, inviting the drive through the covers, Akila threw his bat at it without getting anywhere near the ball and the edge was safely pouched by Ross Taylor at slip

full around middle, the batsman hardly attempts a shot and the ball balloons off the pad to short leg's right, where the fielder takes a diving catch and goes up in appeal, which is quickly turned down
full outside off, steered past slip for one
full and angled in, pushed to mid-on
full and angled in, there's an appeal first for lbw and then a catch at slip but both turned down
the pressure was on and Lakmal has broken the shackles with a time honoured slog over deep midwicket
shorter and flatter, defended with a straight bat
short outside off, cut straight to point
full on middle and leg, defended back
really full and fired in on around middle, perhaps anticipating the sweep, but he gets some bat on it
full around middle, tossed up nicely, gets a thick inside edge from Lakmal, who was way early into his stroke but past midwicket for one
length outside off, he comes forward and defends
full on middle, comes forward to defend but gets it on the pad, missing leg, however
full on off, pushed back to the bowler
quicker one, flatter and straighter, he stays back and is nearly done in as it skids through
full on middle, defended
full on the pads, clipped towards deep midwicket and they come through for two
full outside off, left alone
full and wide outside off, Lakmal throws his bat at it but misses
full outside off, Dickwella goes for the reverse sweep but misses
full and straight, defended off the front foot conventionally
length outside off, he reaches it on the sweep and keeps it along the ground to deep square leg for one

full on middle and off, Lakmal lunges forward to defend, the hint of turn back in induces what appears to be an inside edge onto his pad, after which the ball lobs up to slip. The umpire raises his finger but Lakmal reviews. Replays suggest that there was day light between bat and ball, and the noise that confused the umpire was bat hitting boot as the ball took the pad to slip. Decision overturned
full around off, goes for the big one but only manages an inside edge to short fine leg
full on off, driven to long-off
he goes for the reverse sweep again, it was cleverly fired in on around middle, but gets enough bat to get it away to deep point for one
full on middle, pushed to long-on
attempted sweep missed but he was outside the line
length and angled in, takes a bit of pad and down towards fine-leg for one
full on off, comes forward and defends
beats him. Tall man, Somerville. Gets that to dip from well above his eyeline and spins it past his cover drive
length on off stump, swept to deep square
length on off stump, defended onto the pad off the inside edge
into the pad. Loopy length ball on leg stump. Looks to flick and is beaten on the inside edge
full outside off, chopped to backward point's left off the back foot
full on middle stump, miscues the reverse sweep, finds backward point on the bounce
length at middle stump, bat-pad into the leg side on the front foot
short of a length outside off, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
length on middle, steps out and flicks to midwicket
length on off stump, dead-batted into the leg side
length in the corridor, pushed back down the pitch
length outside off, steps out and drives back to the bowler
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
leading edge dribbles into the extra cover boundary. Length ball on off stump, steps out and completely loses his shape as he looks to club this. No one out in that area of the field
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
oh lovely hit. Full outside off and he uses his reach to get to this and drill it between non-striker and stumps. Long-on can't get to it
full outside off, swept along the turf to deep backward square's right
length on middle stump, steps out and drives to long-on
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up wide outside off, throws his hands at this and is beaten
full on off, driven with the turn to extra cover
slider outside off, chopped straight to backward point
length on middle stump, paddled straight to short fine
length on middle, tapped through square leg

tough chance goes down at short leg. Length on the pads and a forceful flick that hits Latham in the body
length on middle, dead-batted on the front foot
short of a length on off, pushed into the covers off the back foot
length outside off, defended down the pitch
short and wide outside off. Waits on it and steers it to deep backward point's right with an open face
length on off, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, laps it down to long leg
length on off stump, pushed to extra cover on the front foot
full on off stump, dead-batted
past the outside edge. Tossed up outside off and he draws him forward before turning it away
length on middle stump, forced towards long-on off the front foot
length on middle stump, steps out and blocks with the pad
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
bobs up towards backward point, where Ajaz has to put in a last-ditch dive to stop this. An under edge onto pad as he looked to play the reverse sweep
length outside off, left alone
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
length outside off, reaches out for the drive and is beaten by the turn and bounce
length outside off, jabs at it, thick outside edge dribbles past short third
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on leg stump, paddled to short fine's left and then a quick run back into his crease after haring down the pitch
tossed up outside off, pokes to backward point
full on leg stump, pushed through square leg off the front foot
full on leg stump, rapped on the pad as he looks to flick
length on off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, dead-batted on the front foot
full outside off, reverse whip out to deep point
full outside off, left alone
tossed up outside off, beaten as he looks to defend on the front foot
short of a length and ripping away. Has a poke and is beaten again
length on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up outside off, left alone
full outside off, square driven for a couple
length on the pads, pushed to mid-on
full outside off, leans into the ball and drives it to deep cover's left, where Santner fumbles, allowing two
short outside off, attempts the ramp but misses as it comes on really slowly
length outside off, steers it just wide of the diving gully fielder, Williamson and gets a single down to third-man
full on middle, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, uppish reverse sweep to deep backward point
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off

full on middle stump, gets down and laps to deep backward square

length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot

ramps it over the keeper! What a shot that is. Short ball in the corridor, not quite climbing up and not a lot of pace on it as it arrives either. So he's had to time it perfectly to lift it over the keeper
slower short ball, dug very short. Left alone
full at the stumps, tapped down the ground
short outside off, looks to hook, beaten. Appeal for catch behind is turned down
tossed up outside off, ripping past the outside edge as he gets forward
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on middle stump, defended down the pitch
length and wide outside off, left alone

full on leg stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up outside off, driven to extra cover
length outside off, swept to long leg's right. Raval sprints across and slides to stop at the line

full on off stump, dead-batted into the pitch

length on off, slices it out to long leg with a sweep

short outside off, shapes for the reverse sweep, adjusts with the reverse pull. Single at deep point

length outside off, defended to slip with an open face
tossed up at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, jumps up at him as he gets forward to defend

mid-off and mid-on converging. Santner and Raval, respectively. It's right in the middle, and they'd both have to dive backwards to hold that. Santner is the one they decide it will be - and he lunges at it, but can only get a fingertip on that. Lakmal with a rush of blood to the head - went for the slog sweep and got a top edge on that
length at the stumps, stabbed into the off side
length outside off, steps out and is beaten in flight. Forced to pad it away
short of a length and turning into off stump. Shuffles and defends to midwicket
length outside off, lunges a long way forward and defends into the covers
length outside off, drives with the turn to long-on
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up on off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
length and shaped away from off stump. Steered to deep point's right off the back foot ...and he doesn't want the single! That is strange after 24.2 overs together
length and just outside off, defended into the open covers region...still not taking the single
chases and is beaten. Length ball curving away wide outside off. Can't connect on the drive
length and down leg side, can't connect on the flick
full and into the pads. Looks to flick but that's come on slower and lobs back down the pitch
outside edge goes to gully on the bounce. Length ball in the corridor, straightening as he pokes at it
length and in at leg stump, defended off the inside half of the bat
short and wide outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
big turn. Gets this to dip on off stump and spins it past the outside edge
short and wide outside off, backs away and slaps it to the cover boundary
full on off stump, driven with the turn to deep cover
full outside off, finds short fine leg with the sweep
short of a length on the hips, hurriedly poked to square leg off the back foot

past the inside edge. Short of a length and cutting back in after angling away. He wants to slice this behind square and can't connect
full and just outside off, looks to drive off the back foot, it trickles into the off side off the under-edge
clears fine leg! Short ball at off stump, gets the front foot into the leg side and has a big swipe at this. It's off the top edge and comfortably clears that fielder in the end
attempted yorker is a full toss swinging viciously down leg side. Watling can only get a half palm on this and they'll sneak a bye
short of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short of a length on leg stump, nudged to deep square off the back foot
full on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, poked to backward point off the back foot
past the edge. Length on off stump, looks to defend and it turns away
length and wide outside off, looks to slap it on the rise and is beaten
short and wide outside off, steers it to deep point's left....and now the single is taken

oh he's hit his elbow. On Lakmal's bowling arm. Short ball rising up from a middle stump line, just angling away. He's set to try and pull this, but it's a bit too quick for him. Sneaks under his wrists and gets him flush on the lower side of the elbow
short and just outside off, defended into the covers

dragged on! Boult's done just enough to ruffle Lakmal, and that's the end of an important knock. Just three short of a new top score. Short of a length and slanted across him. Backs away, exposes the stumps and has a slog that ends up hitting off stump off the inside edge
full outswinger just outside off, curves past the outside edge
length and wide outside off, left alone

oh lovely shot. Superb footwork. Ajaz around the wicket and tossing this up at middle stump. Midwicket is in. So there's not much risk in attempting to clear that man - provided he's at the pitch of the ball. And he achieves that nicely before clipping it over Williamson
length outside off, looks for the reverse sweep and cops this on the body

checking for run-out at the striker's end. Embuldeniya looked languid, but he's made it. This was a length ball pushed to square leg's right. Direct hit would have had him. On this occasion, there wasn't one
length ball turning in to off stump, inside edge onto pad and into the off side as he defends
short of a length and ripping into the body as he looks to defend
more smart work from Dickwella. Length on leg stump, nudged into the open midwicket region with soft hands
length on leg stump, flicked down to fine leg
short and just outside off. Left alone
length on leg stump, pushed to mid-on's left off the back foot
full on off stump, cutting in off the surface. Looks to defend and gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg
a half-appeal for catch behind. Bouncer in the corridor, sound as it flies through to Watling. No review. That was off his left shoulder
length on leg stump, defended to short fine off the thick inside edge
full on middle stump, defended down the pitch on the front foot
length and wide outside off. Kicks that away

length and wide outside off, big stride before flicking this through the square leg region. That is fifty for Dickwella. It's been an innings of incredible restraint and maturity from a player who has a point to prove
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked into the covers
length and into the pads. Looks to flick and it deflects off the thigh to fine leg
length and just outside off, defended to mid-on
well left. Short one into his body. Gets under it, sways back, lets it pass
short and just outside off, pushed to cover with soft hands
New Zealand review for lbw. Full ball into his pads. A bit of middle stump is visible as this beats his inside edge on the flick. Going down? Yes. That's all their reviews used up.
full and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
neatly played. Length on off stump, steps out and goes inside out to long-off's right, along the turf
tossed up full and wide outside, looks to sweep and cops this on the front pad
full outside off, swept along the floor to deep square's left
length outside off, driven with the turn to deep extra cover's right
length and wide outside off, left alone
length outside off, pushed aerially into the covers region. Everyone's back
short of a length on middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
oh well placed! Looks in complete control right now. Short ball up at the chest, shuffles, swivels, and places this pull right in between fine leg and deep square
length outside off, driven on the rise to long-off
fends awkwardly. Bouncer at his helmet, he hangs the bat up and is rapped on the glove. Too quick for him, eyes off the ball
spears a superb inswinging yorker, he somehow manages to scramble it away. The best toe-crusher that never was

taken superbly at cover! Good bowling, saw the batsman stepping out and held it back a little, the ball dipped on him and Dickwella, looking to hit inside-out, also had to reach for it. Didn't get the elevation and Williamson moved well to his right to take this. Mind you, it was travelling.
drifts in a quicker length delivery from around the stumps, defended.
tossed up outside off, left alone
goes right back and across to defend this shortish delivery into the off side
slider that drifts in from wide of the crease, he's right behind the line in defence
too full, squeezed back to the bowler
just wide of leg slip! This was a snorter of a bouncer angled into the body, somehow he managed to get inside the line and help it along with generous help from the glove and helmet.
has a wild swing at this, the top-edge flies over the keeper and slip, on the bounce to a very fine third man
right behind the line as he blocks out this incoming length delivery
dug in short towards the body, somehow Kumara manages to duck under this
full and straight on leg stump from wide of the crease, kept out
into the blockhole again, squeezed out
shapes to cut, but doesn't get enough bat on it. Rolls wide of cover point

sweeps, misses and that's plumb! Drifting in from around the stumps, Embuldeniya plays a stroke out of desperation, misses and the umpire raised his finger instinctively even before the appeal was finished. Embuldeniya went upstairs for a review just for the heck of it perhaps, no ways that was going to be not out. Keep walking back, mate. Three wickets for Will Somerville and Sri Lanka have an 18-run lead.
full and swinging back in, Raval overbalanced as he looks to clip it off the pad. Pitched outside leg
right behind the line of this length delivery as he tucks this to the leg side
squared up as he squirts this length ball to gully, good stop by Dhananjaya
slants a length ball across the left-hander, defended back
goes right back and across as he defends this incoming delivery
gets a good stride forward and defends the inswinging delivery
nice flight and turn from the rough outside off, left alone
lunges forward to defend, gets a thick edge that rolls to short third man
flatter, skids back in, Latham bunts this to midwicket
this one keeps a touch low as he goes back and across to defend, somehow kept out
shoulders arms to a sharp-spinning delivery from outside off
goes right back into the crease as he plays it back
back of length delivery on middle and leg, tucked wide of square leg and Raval is off the mark
excellent leave! Comes back in a long way, Latham gets well forward and then prefers to let this go.
on the hop as he defends this onto the pad off an inside edge, rolls to gully
shoulders arms to a length ball outside off again
lifter outside off, left alone again
nice and full on the stumps from wide of the crease, eased to mid-on
touch short and angling in, defended
lovely, much like it from Raval as he rocks back and steers behind point
shortish on middle, punched into the covers
drifts in a shortish delivery on middle, Raval is right back into the crease as he defends
lunges forward to defend, squirts this off an inside edge to short leg
left alone as this breaks away sharply from outside off
nice and full but well outside off, left alone. Oversteps so it's a no-ball
attacks the stumps with a length ball, defended back
turns this gently with the angle to short mid-on for a quick single
dug in short but this sails way over the batsman's head as Raval sways out of the way. Good grab by the keeper on the leap
looking to pull but realises this is quite close to his glove and so tries to bail out in the end, just about manages to. The ball was slanting down leg too
huge appeal, massive appeal. Not out says Illingworth. Looks like it may have been missing leg, Sri Lanka don't bother to go upstairs. Karunaratne has a wry smile.
short outside off, Raval gets out of the way without much trouble
slider back in, Latham is hurried into his backfoot push
loopy delivery outside off, left alone
punched straight to cover
nice flight, lands it outside off as he draws him forward, left alone
goes right back and across as he defends this indrifter
tossed up outside off, no turn, left alone
pulled superbly in front of square. Deep midwicket moves to his left to cut that off
short of length outside off, left alone
survives a very poor stroke! Jabs at this length ball outside off, this kisses the seam and jags away. Wasn't far from the outside edge
angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, defended back
slower and fuller outside off, he reaches out to drive but squirts it back off an inside edge
works this with the angle to square leg
gets well forward and defends back
driven with the spin into the gap at mid-off
tossed up on the stumps, he's well forward in defence

got him! Poor from Raval who reaches out to drive but doesn't go through with the shot for some strange reason and ends up chipping it straight to cover. The ball just held onto the surface and skewed off the top part of the bat
squirted into the off side, towards point. They get a second courtesy an overthrow
gets outside the line of the stumps and drives this full delivery to cover
drifting into the pads, clipped nicely to fine leg
gets a good stride forward and plays this full delivery into the off side
gets right on top of the bounce to keep out this short of length delivery
nice and full on the stumps, veers in a tad late, defended back
whips this full ball from outside off to midwicket
runs this down to third man deliberately, clever stuff
slips this length ball down leg, tucked to the man coming in from fine leg
nicely tossed up, inviting the drive, but Latham lets it go
punched away to sweeper point, too short on this occasion
nice and full on the stumps, he gets outside the line and blocks

rolls his wrists over this to work it behind square on the leg side
tucks this incoming length delivery to short leg

steps out, then lunges a bit more to work this with the spin to short midwicket
makes room and punches this into the gap at deep cover
eased with the spin to short cover, got very close to the pitch of the ball
gets well forward and smothers this again
too full, easily kept out by KW
drifts this into middle and leg, whipped into the gap at midwicket and New Zealand draw level
bunts this shortish delivery to cover

sharp turn, he gets well forward to cover the line and block
squeezes this forward defense to short third man
whips this to mid-on
shortish on middle and leg, worked to short leg, who stops it with his left hand
gets well forward and defends, rolls back but he stops it with the bat
dabs this into the off side
goes onto the back foot to this tossed up ball and gently pats it to slip
works this against the turn to mid-on
nearly rolled back onto the stumps! Williamson survives after a very tentative prod, nearly played down the wrong line, rolled back nearly onto the off stump off the inside edge. Incredible escape.
tossed up outside off. Gets forward and pushes it down the pitch
past the edge but to his credit, Latham was defending inside the line and close to his body on the back foot, unlike his dismissal in the first innings
length at middle stump, skidding on with the angle. Flicked to deep square off the back foot

full outside off, solidly defended down the pitch
full toss on off stump. Williamson already committed on the front foot and low. He can't adjust to put this away with any power. Harmless tap to short extra
length on off stump, steps out and is beaten in flight, but manages to block solidly in the end
full outside off, leans in and pushes away from the body. Down the pitch

taken by mid-on! Splendid bowling from Embuldeniya, and backed up superbly by Kusal Perera at mid-on, running and then leaping backwards as the wind took the ball over him, and holding on with the reverse cup. Ordinary shot from Williamson after an overall strange and uncharacteristically antsy approach all over long. This is tossed up at off stump, but dipping. He's gone down the pitch and looked to hit it straight over after being beaten in flight. Premeditated? Looks like it. In the end he can only flap at it with his top arm, and it ends up going high over the bowler. Bowler more patient than batsman, and it's paid off
length on middle stump, flicked to deep square
pings off the inside half. Length at middle and he steps out and pushes with hard hands, in front of the body. It rolls out through midwicket
length ball spinning down leg. Reaches out and looks to flick, beaten
tossed up at middle stump, driven out to long-on
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover off the back foot
legbreak on a good length, sliding into the corridor. Left alone
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at middle stump, steps out and jams it down to long-on
short of a length and turning into the hip. Expertly turned out to deep backward square off the back foot

oh can you believe this? Taylor has run down the pitch to an extremely wide length ball outside off. Nowhere near the pitch of it as it turns away. And from there, no choice but to throw his hands at it and hope for the best. He gets a thick edge that sits up nicely to first slip's right. Embuldeniya rewarded again for slowing it down and tossing it up. Taylor was all over him in the first innings, so he's really enjoyed this, the youngster. Lets out a scream
length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
length at middle, flicked out to deep square
just short of leg slip. Short of a length on leg stump, wants to dab this to deep square off the back foot. Just manages to keep it down
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump defended off the inside half on the front foot
length outside off and turning away. Pushes at it with hard hands as he defends away from the body
tossed up on middle stump, defended down the pitch
length outside off, pushes again on the front foot. Thick outside edge to backward point

direct-hit at the non-striker's end. Sent upstairs. Angelo Mathews with the moves at mid-on. Suspect Latham has just made it though. He has, yes. Length ball at middle, stepped out and flicked and took off with a good call. They've even managed a second as the ball deflected out into the leg side
down leg and spinning past the keeper. Length on leg stump, can't get to that as it spins. Neither can Watling Dickwellade
shot! That is imperious. Down the pitch, watches it closely as it lands and goes with the turn with perfect timing. Launches it over the midwicket boundary
length on middle stump, defended off the inside half on the front foot

firmly punched through midwicket off the back foot. That's nice balance. Length on middle stump, deep in the crease and holds his shape
length on off, blocked on the front foot

75kph, lobbed right up on off stump. Dead-batted on the front foot

shot. Well controlled sweep. Length outside off, a tad flatter from Embuldeniya. Latham nice and low and getting a good stretch out to meet this and give backward square no chance to his right

superb sliding stop at deep backward square. Kusal Perera. It's a full toss on leg stump and there's a lot of bat on this swish from Latham. Perera sprints ten yards and puts in a dive to hold onto this
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length on off, defended on the back foot

length at off stump, defends inside the line and gets a thick outside edge into the off side
shot. Tossed up wide outside off, drags it out to deep midwicket with a sweep

length on middle stump, steps out and drives. Midwicket dives to his right to stop that
tossed up at off stump, dead-batted on the front foot
full on off stump, blocked on the front foot

beaten. Tentative already. Length outside off, gets forward and pokes away from the body as this rips away

short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short of a length outisde off. Attempted googly. Gets deep in the crease and whips this off the back foot, rather than look for the pull. Straighter bat as a result. Safe runs wide of mid-on
a repeat of the first ball. Tossed up outside off, down for the sweep, struck on the thigh well outside the line. More leg byes past slip

taken at gully! That field change has worked! Thirimanne, very close in with the helmet on. Length ball outside off, gets forward to defend but there's just too much fizz on that for him to control it. Rips onto the outside edge. He's played with soft hands so this is going into the turf. But that fielder has been placed exactly for that. And he holds on
sharp turn from outside off, defended with soft hands
gets well forward and turns this to short leg
rolls his wrists over the ball to nudge this wide of leg gully
laced into the gap at cover
steps out and eases this full delivery to long-off

sharp turn from he rough outside off, left alone
defended with soft hands

reads the googly, gets well forward and smothers this
goes right back into the crease as he keeps out this shortish delivery
gets well forward and defends back this tossed up delivery
nice and full on the stumps, defended back again
swept fiercely to deep backward square leg

there's some bat on this as Watling prods forward to defend. A very, very thin one if any, before it crashed onto his right pad. Would've smashed into the stumps but once it nicked the bat, everything else becomes void. Oh, dear. Looked out at first instance, so you can't really blame the umpire. Decision overturned
defended with the angle into the leg side
hit on the chest as he attempts a premeditated paddle from outside off
covers the line, gets well forward and defends
good leave to one that dips and spins away

lunges forward and smothers this nicely

too full on the stumps, kept out

looks to squeeze this drive through cover, good top by silly point who puts his right hand out to save a couple of runs
fired full on the stumps, defended back

gets well forward and defends this full in-drifter
squirts this forward defense to the leg side

gets the bat well in front of the pad to keep that out
carefully defended as he gets onto the frontfoot

drifting into middle and leg, tucks this off a length to short leg
well forward as he pats back
nicely forward, almost as if he wants to smell the leather, as he defends
steps out to drive inside-out, gets too close to the pitch, squeezed back

prods outside the line as the inside-edge rolls into the leg side
squirts one off an outside edge, rolls to short third man. Played with the bat well in front of the pad
put down by Dickwella! Rose early with the bounce, was also moving leg because the ball drifted that way and by the time he changed tracks, the chance had been fluffed. Oh, dear.
arm-ball that slides in and straightens, left alone

swept from the stumps to deep square

left alone as this one spins away from outside off
gets the bat well in front of the pad as he deadbats this

taken at slip! Sharp turn and a jab with hard hands has done the trick. He was looking to defend but this one dipped on him and the fizz does the rest. So the dropped chance by Dickwella doesn't cost them much.
gets outside the line to smothers this full delivery
punched into the gap at cover point for a quick single

punches to point

pulled and he's holed out to deep midwicket. What have you done, Santner? Right at the stroke of tea. No control of this pull, looks like he got overexcited looking at one that was dropped so short. Runs were coming in a trickle, so the moment he saw this, his first instinct was to take him on with the pull. This one kept a touch low as well, so he didn't get it off the middle. A pie has got Sri Lanka a wicket and This Test turns again as they walk off for tea.
